src.transform_world_image.transform_shot package#

Submodules#

src.transform_world_image.transform_shot.conversion_coor_shot module#

Module to conversion z for WorldImageShot and ImageWorldShot

src.transform_world_image.transform_shot.conversion_coor_shot.conv_output_z_type(coor: ndarray, type_z_input: str, type_z_output: str) → ndarray[source]#

Convert type z to the output given.

Parameters:

  • coor (Union[float, np.ndarray]) – Coordinate [X, Y, Z].

  • type_z_input (str) – Z type in input “height” or “altitude”.

  • type_z_output (str) – Z type in output “height” or “altitude”.

Returns:

Coodinate x, y, z.

Return type:

np.array

src.transform_world_image.transform_shot.conversion_coor_shot.conv_z_shot_to_z_data(shot: Shot, type_z_shot: str, type_z_data: str, nonadir: bool = True, approx: bool = False) → ndarray[source]#

Convert type z shot to type z data. The Z of the object is NOT modified.

Parameters:

  • shot (Shot) – Shot to process.

  • type_z_shot (str) – Shot type z “altitude” or “height”.

  • type_z_data (str) – Data type z “altitude” or “height”.

  • nonadir (bool) – To calculate nadir no take linear alteration.

Returns:

Shot position coordinate with type z asking.

Return type:

np.array

image_to_world(img_coor: ndarray, type_z_data: str, type_z_shot: str, nonadir: bool = True) → ndarray[source]#

Calculate x and y cartographique coordinate with z.

Parameters:

  • img_coor (np.array) – Image coordinate [col line].

  • type_z_data (str) – Type of z data you want in output, “height” or “altitude”.

  • type_z_shot (str) – Type of z shot, “height” or “altitude”.

  • nonadir (bool) – To calculate nadir no take linear alteration.

Returns:

Cartographique coordinate [x,y,z].

Return type:

np.array

Calculate x and y cartographique coordinate with z.

Parameters:

  • img_coor (np.array) – Image coordinate [col line].

  • type_z_shot (str) – Type of z “height” or “altitude”.

  • z (Union[np.array, float]) – La position z du point par défault = 0.

  • nonadir (bool) – To calculate nadir no take linear alteration.

Returns:

Cartographique coordinate [x,y,z].

Return type:

np.array

  • pos_eucli (np.array) – Shot position in the euclidean system.

  • z (np.array) – Z position of points.

[X, Y, Z] in euclidean system.

src.transform_world_image.transform_shot.space_resection module#

Module for recalculate shooting position

class src.transform_world_image.transform_shot.space_resection.SpaceResection(shot: Shot, cam: Camera, type_z_data: str, type_z_shot: str)[source]#

Bases: object

Recalculates the shot’s 6 external orientation parameters, the 3 angles omega, phi, kappa and its position x, y, z.

Parameters:

  • shot (Shot) – Shot to recalculte externa parameters.

  • cam (Camera) – Camera of the shot.

  • type_z_data (str) – z’s type of data, “height” or “altitude”.

  • type_z_shot (str) – z’s type of shot, “height” or “altitude”.

least_square_shot(shot_adjust: Shot, obs: ndarray, pt_eucli: ndarray, pt_world: ndarray) → Shot[source]#

Least-square methode to calcule the shot’s 6 external orientation parameters.

Parameters:

  • shot_adjust (Shot) – The shot to adjust.

  • obs (np.array) – Observation of point in image [c_obs, l_obs].

  • pt_eucli (np.array) – Observation of world point in eucidean system [X, Y, Z].

  • pt_world (np.array) – Observation of world point [X, Y, Z].

Returns:

Adjusted shot.

Return type:

Shot

mat_obs_axia(pt_eucli: ndarray, imc_adjust: Shot) → ndarray[source]#

Setting up the mat_a matrix to solve the system by axiator.

Parameters:

  • pt_eucli (np.array) – Coordinate [X, Y, Z] euclidean.

  • imc_adjust (Shot) – adjusted shot.

Returns:

Matrix A.

Return type:

np.array

seed_20_point() → tuple[source]#

Positioning of 20 points on an image by percentage position on width and height. The z-world position is given by fixed values.

Returns:

Tuple of 3 elements (position column obs, position line obs, z world).

Return type:

np.array

space_resection(add_pixel: tuple = (0, 0)) → Shot[source]#

Recalculates the shot’s 6 external orientation parameters, the 3 angles omega, phi, kappa and its position x, y, z.

Parameters:

add_pixel (tuble) – Pixel to be added to change marker.

Returns:

Adjusted shot.

Return type:

Shot

eucli_to_bundle(p_eucli: ndarray, type_z_data: str, type_z_shot: str) → ndarray[source]#

Convert euclidean coordinate to bundle coordinate.

Parameters:

  • p_eucli (np.array) – The euclidean coordinate [x, y, z] of ground point.

  • type_z_data (str) – Type of z of data, “height” or “altitude”.

  • type_z_shot (str) – Type of z of worksite, “height” or “altitude”.

Returns:

Bundle coordinate [c,l].

Return type:

np.array

Convert euclidean coordinate to image coordinate.

Parameters:

  • p_eucli (np.array) – The euclidean coordinate [x, y, z] of ground point.

  • type_z_data (str) – Type of z of data, “height” or “altitude”.

  • type_z_shot (str) – Type of z of worksite, “height” or “altitude”.

Returns:

Bundle coordinate [c,l].

Return type:

np.array

world_to_image(coor_world: ndarray, type_z_data: str, type_z_shot: str) → ndarray[source]#

Calculates the c,l coordinates of a terrain point in an image.

Parameters:

  • coor_world (np.array) – The coordinate [x, y, z] of ground point.

  • type_z_data (str) – Type of z of data, “height” or “altitude”.

  • type_z_shot (str) – Type of z of worksite, “height” or “altitude”.

The image coordinate [c,l].
